abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan would finance the
            estimated foreign exchange cost of a program for the
            improvement of about 580 km and the construction of about
            462 km of federal highways. Since the Bank's first road
            loan to Mexico, good progress has been made in developing a
            modern highway system in the country, and the length of the
            federal system has increased from 21,000 km in 1960 to
            27,000 km in 1968. At the same time the quality of the roads
            has been improved and nearly 60 percent of the system is now
            paved. The project is a continuation of this process.
